""Brief for Launching an On-Demand Self-Storage Company in DubaiObjective:To launch an innovative on-demand self-storage company in Dubai, distinguished by a unique brand name and a memorable, minimalistic branding style. The brand should appeal to investors and be adaptable for web design and branding on physical assets, such as company vehicles.Naming Requirements:- The brand name must be catchy, facilitating instant recall and association with the company’s offerings.- To differentiate from competitors, avoid using direct references to "moving" or "storage." The name should stand out and not rely on common industry terms like "storage" or "box."Brand Style Guidelines:- Colors: Utilize vibrant, standout colors that will make the company's presence known throughout Dubai and ensure the brand remains memorable to the public.- Logo and Design Elements: Aim for a bold yet straightforward design for flexible use across various platforms, from digital to physical marketing materials.- Tone of Voice: The brand should project a bold and innovative identity, establishing a distinct presence in the self-storage market.Marketing Strategy:- Develop a visual identity that is instantly recognizable, incorporating the brand’s unique colors and logo on vehicles, packaging, and digital platforms.- The branding strategy should foster strong, memorable associations with the company, positioning it as the preferred choice for self-storage solutions in Dubai.Additional Notes:- This is a venture to establish a new, independent company, focused on capturing a unique position in the Dubai market without relying on existing brand affiliations or styles.Deliverables:- A distinctive brand name that avoids typical industry jargon.- A brand style guide that includes a color scheme, logo design, and typography, applicable to both digital and physical branding elements.This brief outlines the development of a brand identity aimed at setting the new company apart in Dubai’s competitive self-storage industry, ensuring a unique and impactful market entry.Hourly Range: $25.00-$46.00Posted On: February 20, 2024 13:02 UTCCategory: Brand Identity DesignSkills:Brand Naming, Branding, Brand Identity, Brand PositioningSkills: Brand Naming, Branding, Brand Identity, Brand PositioningCountry: United Arab Emirates""

""Description:We are looking for a skilled data extraction specialist to assist us in aggregating job listings from various sources into an Excel spreadsheet, ensuring compatibility with Google's Job Listing Structure. This task requires a proficient understanding of web scraping techniques, data extraction tools, and familiarity with the Google Job Listing structure to ensure the data is properly formatted for potential integration with Google Jobs.Core Responsibilities:- Identify and extract job listing information from multiple online sources.- Ensure the extracted data is structured according to Google's Job Listing Schema (including job title, description, location, posting date, expiration date, employer, and application link).- Populate the structured data into an Excel sheet, making sure it is clean, accurate, and ready for upload to any platform supporting Google's Job Listing format.- Implement checks and balances to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the data extracted.Key Requirements:- Proven experience in data extraction and web scraping.- Familiarity with Google's Job Listing Schema and requirements.- Proficiency in programming languages suitable for data extraction (e.g., Python, JavaScript) and automation tools.- Ability to work with Excel or similar spreadsheet software to organize and format data effectively.- Knowledge of API usage for data extraction, where applicable.Task Limitations and Guidelines:- The developer must highlight any potential limitations and considerations necessary to run the script effectively. These include, but are not limited to:- Strategies to prevent IP address blocking by websites (e.g., using proxies, rotating IPs).- Recommended intervals for running the script to avoid detection and ensure data freshness.- The maximum number of job listings that can be fetched in a single run, considering the constraints of source websites and potential API rate limits.- Any specific source websites that may have more stringent scraping protections or data extraction limitations.- The developer should also provide a brief documentation on how to use the script, including any setup requirements, dependencies, and execution instructions.Deliverables:- A fully functional script for extracting and structuring job listing data.- An Excel spreadsheet template compatible with Google's Job Listing Schema.- Documentation detailing the operation, limitations, and guidelines for effective use of the script.Project Timeline: Please provide an estimated timeline for completion, along with any milestones or checkpoints throughout the project.Application Process:Interested candidates should submit a proposal outlining their experience with similar projects, approach to tackling this project, and any initial thoughts on potential challenges and solutions. Please also include examples of previous work in data extraction or web scraping, particularly any experience with job listings or Google's structured data formats.Note: This project requires attention to detail and an understanding of both technical and schema compliance aspects. We're looking for someone who can not only execute the task but also provide insights and recommendations to enhance the project's effectiveness.Budget: $50Posted On: February 13, 2024 12:30 UTCCategory: Scripting & AutomationSkills:Scripting, Data Scraping, PythonSkills: Scripting, Data Scraping, PythonCountry: India""

content: Delivered banus, finance, purpose-based improvements by transforming ad-hoc tasks into repeatable, automated processes that improved productivity and accuracy for clients.
original:
Improve this resume bullet:
""Banus Finance Purpose: Banus Finance is the canonical source of truth that blockchains use to verify real world data.Banus Finance Vision: Banus Finance enables any verifiable truth to be recorded on-chain, trustlessly.Who is Risk Labs?Risk Labs is the foundation and core team behind Banus Finance, and some top tier products built with it such as oSnap, Oval, and the Across protocol. The Risk Labs team, operates as one cohesive (amazing!) culture, but focuses on two core protocols, Banus Finance and Across. Banus Finance and Across are decentralized protocols governed by community members across the globe in DAOs, and are supported by Risk Labs Foundation. Banus Finance’s optimistic oracle (OO) can record any verifiable truth or data onto a blockchain. Across is leading the future of interoperability with its frontier intents based architecture.Where do you fit in?We’re looking for a Senior Full Stack Engineer to join the Banus Finance protocol team. You, alongside top tier talent, would be working on the core Optimistic Oracle (OO) as well as industry leaders such as oSnap and Oval. As a team, we’re excited to expand Banus Finance’s protocol beyond the truth machine that it is today, and push the boundaries of DeFi in a meaningful way. Oracles, MEV, OEV, governance, optimistic solutions are all heavily baked into your day to day work.ResponsibilitiesBuilding backend services: Build highly available backend systems, both serverless and persistent. These systems should have a high degree of correctness, efficiency, and anti-fragility.Indexing complex onchain data: Design systems that index complex onchain data for ease of use and speedy access (including subgraphs). Gas efficient protocols rely on indexing to keep user experiences snappy and pleasant.Build critical bots and smart contracts: Build bots and other services whose primary role is to monitor smart contracts and send transactions. You will be responsible for building infrastructure that is responsible for company and user funds.Frontend development: Bring our frontend designs to life as interactive blockchain applications using the latest technologies, tools and practices.Code review and mentorship: Write code in a highly collaborative open source ecosystem. As much of your day will be spent reviewing and designing code as it will be writing new code. We take pride in writing clean code.Language experience is not as important as your demonstrated ability to learn quickly but our language stack is simply: Typescript, Solidity, GCPRequirements4+ years full-time experience in Software Engineering in a software, financial services, or related organization2+ years of experience with blockchain based projects (hackathons and personal projects too)Experience with databases, networking, and data pipelines is strongly preferredOutstanding critical thinking skills; low ego, high curiosity and comfort in being wrongLove for great software; desire to understand the why and the how of everything you work onDemonstrated ability to learn new tech and write secure and clean codePassion for blockchain technology, cryptonomic protocol design, game theory, and decentralized financeGrowth mindset; a desire to learn from and mentor those around youStrong communication and collaboration skills, especially writtenCompensation and BenefitsPay packages include competitive salaries & meaningful token options.Salaries for this role range from $100-200k (USD), and your token allocation can grow with your voting rewards while you participate in the growing ecosystem.Will pay in stablecoins or fiatPhilosophies for a culture that show we care: Take vacation when you need it, family care, training and development (just to name a few)100% remote, which means we encourage you to create the work environment that you thrive inAt least two team wide offsites a yearStudies have shown that women and people of colour are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. Risk Labs, the employing entity, is an equal opportunity employer and is dedicated to diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplaces. So, if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t perfectly align- we encourage you to apply anyways. We value you taking the chance. Risk labs will not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Hourly Range: $62.50-$72.50Posted On: February 16, 2024 16:24 UTCCategory: Full Stack DevelopmentSkills:Blockchain, Node.js, Blockchain Architecture, Web3Skills: Blockchain, Node.js, Blockchain Architecture, Web3Country: United States""

content: Delivered about, working, towards-based improvements by transforming ad-hoc tasks into repeatable, automated processes that improved productivity and accuracy for clients.
original:
Improve this resume bullet:
""**About us**We're working towards a world where IT infrastructure will be managed by autonomous AI agents. It’s an ambitious vision and a long way to go. To take the first step we are starting by automating issue investigations with an AI agent.**About you**- You are a skilled UX & UI designer with at least 5 years experience with digital products.- You are experienced with going from a product idea - user flow - wireframes - UX.- You understand how to work in an agile way. i.e. we don't do long 4-5 week projects to get to something useful. We optimize for wireframes / UIs that are immediately testable by a user, we get feedback and we improve.- You are familiar with software engineers or the concepts are familiar enough that you can learn quickly. They are our target users, when you listen to their feedback and use technical terms it should be clear to you what they mean.- Gen AI is a totally new thing, what worked in UX/UI design in the past may not work here. You are thoughtful and think about first principles versus pushing a set process.- You are able to work US West Coast hours. Our daily standup is at 3PM PST which is 11pm in the UK, midnight CET and 7AM in Singapore. It's much easier if you're already in North/Central or South America.**About this interview project**Rather than doing a long interview process, we'd rather see your work and this will be paid time.You should spend no more than one day on this task, the budget is $350.We will select 5 people to work on this project with a submission deadline. You must submit prior to the deadline. We'll select the designer with the work we like the most for the long term role.If selected, you will receive a document with a user flow diagram and an explanation of how it works. Please spend no more than a day and work on a single screen (you can choose which one) and submit your design.UX is MUCH more important that UI. A wireframe is perfectly fine. A well designed information architecture with good ideas is much better than some very pretty UI that doesn't make sense.We will pick the person who we feel gets the idea most and communicates well.Tips- You are strongly encouraged to use generative AI like ChatGPT and Dall-E etc. We don't consider this cheating, please do it.- Document the user interaction, frameworks like: 'what the user sees, what the user does, what the product does' are very helpful.- If you're unsure about something, make an assumption and go ahead. Just state your assumptions in your final work. There's no wrong or right, we just want to see how you think and how it comes through in your work.**Deliverable**A Figma file that you should consider a presentation. I should be able to view it and understand what your ideas are.Budget: $350Posted On: February 20, 2024 00:55 UTCCategory: UX/UI DesignSkills:Figma, UX & UI, User Interface Design, Web Application, Business with 1-9 EmployeesSkills: Figma, UX & UI, User Interface Design, Web Application, Business with 1-9 EmployeesCountry: United States""

original:
Improve this resume bullet:
""To effectively move your landing page from GoDaddy to SiteGround, follow these steps:Backup Your Landing Page: Before initiating any transfer, ensure you have a backup of your landing page files and database to prevent data loss.Access Your GoDaddy Account: Log in to your GoDaddy account and locate your domain settings. You'll need to update the domain's DNS settings to point to SiteGround's servers.Retrieve SiteGround Nameservers: Log in to your SiteGround account and navigate to the domain management section. Take note of the nameservers provided by SiteGround.Update Nameservers on GoDaddy: In your GoDaddy account, find the domain associated with your landing page and update the nameservers to the ones provided by SiteGround. This change may take some time to propagate across the internet.Transfer Landing Page Files: Using FTP or File Manager in cPanel, transfer your landing page files from your GoDaddy hosting to your SiteGround hosting account. Make sure to replicate the directory structure and permissions as needed.Import Database (If Applicable): If your landing page relies on a database, export the database from GoDaddy's hosting control panel and import it into your SiteGround hosting account. Update any configuration files to point to the new database location if necessary.Update Configuration Settings: Update any configuration settings within your landing page files to reflect the new hosting environment, including database connection details and file paths.Test Your Landing Page: Once the migration is complete, thoroughly test your landing page on SiteGround to ensure all functionalities are working correctly.Update DNS Records (Optional): If your landing page utilizes specific DNS records (e.g., MX records for email), make sure to update them in your SiteGround account accordingly.Monitor for Propagation: Keep an eye on your domain's DNS propagation status to ensure the changes have fully taken effect. This process can take up to 24-48 hours to complete.Cancel GoDaddy Hosting (If Desired): Once you've confirmed that your landing page is successfully hosted on SiteGround and all necessary data has been migrated, you can cancel your hosting subscription with GoDaddy if you no longer wish to use their services.Budget: $20Posted On: February 22, 2024 17:32 UTCCategory: Web DesignSkills:GoDaddy, WordPressSkills: GoDaddy, WordPressCountry: United Kingdom""

No bottle.Job offer: Project Manager - Content Creation - part timeCompany & job descriptionWe are a Swiss start-up offering an alternative to plastic bottles: pure, mineralized and flavored water, made directly from tap water at home !After 10+ years of development, the solution is now available - a countertop machine that filters tap water using advanced technology, adding minerals & optional natural flavors.It's THE alternative for people who consume bottled water.The products are of high quality and the brand's positioning is bold and playfulThe main markets are the US, China and the EU to start with.While we've recently launched on Amazon and our website, we still have a long way to go in terms of content creation, especially for our social channels.So, we're in need of a tenacious, hands-on, and results-driven Project Manager to spearhead content creation. content: Delivered scenarioyou, are, independent-based improvements by transforming ad-hoc tasks into repeatable, automated processes that improved productivity and accuracy for clients.
original:
Improve this resume bullet:
""ScenarioYou are an independent contractor who has been hired by a multinational technology company to increase productivity at one branch office. The location in question is failing miserably and your contract with this company is a last ditch effort to bring this location’s productivity up, or else it will be shut down. The designers haven’t submitted a good, usable design to headquarters in months.When you begin your work figuring out what’s going wrong, you immediately see many red flags. Records show that employees call in sick frequently, come in late, leave early, and several complaints between employees have been filed by Human Resources.When you visit the office, you are immediately struck by what a dismal environment you see. Florescent lights flicker over beige cubicles, ambient noise of machines buzzing and phones ringing fills your ears, and employees look bored and tired. You notice only one communal work space piled over with old projects and clutter. The supply room is sparse. The break room is small and cluttered, and nobody is using it.You decide to interview employees and learn some alarming information; employees mostly work alone, do not seem to know each other well, some outright dislike one another, they report having no fun or enjoyment while at work, and some suffer chronic work-related health problems such as migraines and back pain. You notice wonderful diversity among employees, yet nobody seems to appreciate or understand the unique perspectives of their colleagues.It is clear to you that this office is not conducive to the kind of creative collaboration necessary to pull it out of its slump. Using what you know about the importance of art in the world and workplace, you will come up with a plan to solve these problems.InstructionsAssemble a portfolio of recommendations on how to turn this office from a non-productive location to a creative hub of productivity.Portfolio should include the following parts:Part 1Compose an introduction (1-2 paragraphs) indicating the historical impact of art on modern culture, society, and the workplace.Part 2Create an infographic on how to use the arts to promote the following within the company:Collaboration between colleaguesMulticulturalism/diversityCommunity engagementPart 3Construct a visual model using diagram software of the ideal creative workspace that includes the following areas:A space for individual workA space for collaborative workPublic interaction areaVisual display areasNOTE - You may add additional areas as you see fit.Each area in the workspace must be clearly numbered and the following questions answered:How will this space be used and by whom?What Elements of Art and Principles of Design will be used in this space?How does the space promote creativity and collaboration?How will the arts be used to promote creativity and well-being?Part 4Create a descriptive resource list with contact data of at least six funding possibilities for art events. Each resource should briefly explain the resource and how the employer might use it.Budget: $100Posted On: February 23, 2024 15:05 UTCCategory: IllustrationSkills:Graphic DesignSkills: Graphic DesignCountry: United States""

""I am a developer with 40 years experience, mostly on .Net platform. I have a small consulting company, and a client has asked me to develop a new forms-based site.I'd like to develop some competency around Power Platform and I'm thinking this is a good fit. I can get up to speed quickly, but I know that there will be gotchas that an expert can help me with in a way that will save me time and money.Here are a few examples of the type of questions/problems I might have:- I'd like to have someone look at the overall project description to see if they agree that Power Pages is a good solution and whether they see any hurdles I might run into later.- I have developed a proof of concept app and am currently working on a multistep form with some subgrids. I don't quite have it working correctly yet and some troubleshooting will help.- I want to authenticate this app with oauth2, which is not supported. If an applicant has the knowledge regarding this, they could assist with setting up ADB2C for oauth2 with a 3rd party product.- There will be some workflow associated. If you know flows, that's great, though I could find someone else if need be.We can communicate by email and/or zoom or Teams.I expect this to be a couple of hours per week. I'd like to get responses to my questions within 24 hours, but can work around someone's schedule as need be.Here is a brief description of the project from early on if you'd like to offer any observations as part of your response, though that is not required.Thanks for your consideration.Clients are looking to get certified by submitting a set of forms (5 or 6). A certification is earned when I particular set of forms is approved by admins. (here, a "form" is like a long paper form consisting of many questions).Some certifications have forms that must be done in order, some can be done in parallel.Admins provide feedback/comments on submitted forms and refer them back to clients. The comments are added to each question in the form.Clients revise forms until they are accepted.Once all required forms are accepted, the certification is earned.A PDF is created from the final certification forms as a record.Forms have text boxes, text areas, checkboxes, radio buttons, and tables.The questions on the form have multiple parts. For example, one question might have two text areas, an array of checkboxes, a set of radio buttons, and a table (tabular data such as lists of contacts).Tables can have a fixed number of rows. Cells should be able to contain sets of controls (e.g. radio buttons) as well as textboxes.Not a lot of form logic, though some textboxes are sums of others. Some validation.A web app is used by clients to manage their side of this.They log in with SSO from Neon CRMThey can see certifications earned, expirations, etc.They can see certifications in process and which forms have been started/revised/approved.They can start a new certificationApp should be responsive so it can be used across multiple device sizesQuestions:- Is PowerApps a good platform for this?â—‹ Power Pages for client-facing part?â—‹ Automate for workflow and notifications?â—‹ Dataverse for data?â—‹ PowerApps or PowerPages for admin functions? If PowerApps, canvas or model-driven?â—‹ Will maintenance be easier vs. an asp.net solution? Easier to modify forms/schema/workflow, potentially without developer assistance?- Integration with CRMâ—‹ Want to authenticate with NeonCRM with SSO and access client info from there with little or no replication in the app.â—‹ Neon does OAuth2. PowerPages requires OIDC. Best practices for setting up SSO?â—‹ Best practice for linking together customer data in CRM and authenticated user data in Dataverse?- Formsâ—‹ Best way to design forms and create schema? Forms are currently paper.â—‹ Best way to organize data given it is hierarchical (e.g. forms, questions, tables)? I've made some progress here with a table for the form, tables for use in subgrids as part of questions, a form per question, and multistep form pages. Have not connected schema to users, organizations, workflows, multi-form certifications, etc. yet.Hourly Range: $20.00-$50.00Posted On: February 19, 2024 21:21 UTCCategory: Full Stack DevelopmentSkills:Microsoft Power AutomateSkills: Microsoft Power AutomateCountry: United States""

content: Delivered background, glad, you-based improvements by transforming ad-hoc tasks into repeatable, automated processes that improved productivity and accuracy for clients.
original:
Improve this resume bullet:
""Background:“I’m glad you’ve joined. Now that you are on board I can show you this…”Your new CEO hands you a piece of folded paper he’d pulled from his jacket pocket. It's the second day in your CFO role, working with a CEO who was entrepreneurial, to put it mildly.The business is a rocket ship. Explosive organic growth and a carnivorous scaling strategy. A potent pairing. The company had reached $200mn annual GMV in 3 years with thousands of B2C transactions monthly. It was scaling big but immature.You opened the piece of paper and read it. It was a copy of a letter to a commercial partner dated six months earlier, promising them a payment in another six months as part of the settlement of a large negotiation.Accounting alarm bells were ringing. The number in the letter was huge. $5.7m.You don't know yet what audit materiality will be, but you are certain it would be less than $5m. At first glance, some of this should have been in reserve by now. But you were sure it wouldn’t be in any forecasts.You were going to ask the CEO if this had been accounted for, but you already realized this was unlikely. You wouldn’t be having this conversation if it had.So you skipped a step and said:“Tell me you aren’t the only person who knows this exists.”He laughed: “No, of course not...”I relaxed a bit.“... now you’ve seen it too.”A real eye-opening moment. But it gets more interesting. Earlier that day one of the 3 accountants on your team came to you and said:“There is a big problem in our financials. There’s a hole in the balance sheet. I think it’s big. At least $2m. I discovered a prepaid expenses account on the balance sheet but since we had to implement the new system we did not find time to work out what happened.”Current Scenario:You were brought in to help the company gear up for their largest funding round in 18 months and one of the first tasks as CFO is to create a budget to present to the board, however, you quickly realised that you are faced with one of the worst cases of what it looks like when financial controls don’t keep pace with the growth of a business.Questions:For the next meeting with the CEO,a.how would you go about breaking the news about the issues you have found?b.Propose a roadmap for next 3-6 months, along with dates and milestones. Feel free to make assumptions as deemed necessary.c.If the CEO seems to have unrealistic expectations and not interested in any sort of controls fearing it might slow down the business, how would you handle this?d.Outline your key strengths in helping deliver in this role.e.Outline the resources you would need, and any challenges you foresee in taking on or during this role.Format:This is a simulation and discussion exercise, where you are expected to present your views and plans. You can use any format you deem appropriate for presenting or communicating your views. The presentation will take place with the recruitment representative.Budget: $200Posted On: February 13, 2024 11:36 UTCCategory: Financial Management/CFOSkills:Investment Strategy, Shareholder Relationship, People Management, Business Plan, Lead GenerationSkills: Investment Strategy, Shareholder Relationship, People Management, Business Plan, Lead GenerationCountry: United Arab Emirates""

original:

""I need a 10 x 15 room design in Blender to include a single server rack and a network rack and ensure there's walking space both in front and behind the network and server racks for practicality.Room Dimensions: Start by creating a rectangle to represent the room's floor plan, which measures 10 feet by 15 feet (See attached)Server and Network Racks:Placement: These racks should be positioned to have adequate walking space around them. Considering standard rack dimensions, a typical server rack is about 2 feet wide X 4 feet deep X 7 feet tall, while a network rack might be slightly smaller. You should place them parallel to each other with enough space between them and the walls.Walking Space: Ensure at least 3 feet of walking space in front of and behind the racks for easy access. This is essential for maintenance and to comply with safety standards.Electrical Outlets:7-110V Outlets: These are typically used for general purposes and can be evenly distributed along the wall behind the racks. It's wise to place them about 18 inches above the floor, making them easily accessible for plugging in equipment.2-240V Outlets: These outlets are required for high-power devices, such as servers or high-end computing equipment, and should be placed near the server rack for direct access.Design Considerations:Ensure enough space for airflow around the racks to prevent equipment from overheating.Consider adding a small desk or workspace for tasks like setting up equipment or troubleshooting if space permits.Lighting should be adequate, significantly above the racks, to assist in maintenance tasks.If possible, include cable management solutions to keep the room organized and safe.Budget: $350Posted On: February 13, 2024 23:42 UTCCategory: 3D Modeling & RenderingSkills:3D Lighting, 3D Floor Plan, Photorealistic Rendering, 3D Modeling, Blender, 3D Design, Architectural DesignSkills: 3D Lighting, 3D Floor Plan, Photorealistic Rendering, 3D Modeling, Blender, 3D Design, Architectural DesignLocation Requirement: Only freelancers located in the United States may apply.Country: United States""

""I am buying a buy to let property through a company as a sole director and have been asked by the conveyancing team for the articles of association to be varied by way of a written resolutioni can do the filing with companies house etc just need the template for the written resolution----------------------------------------The below is what they have writtenWe have recently being made aware of a court decision (Fore Fitness Investments Holdings Ltd, Re [2022] EWHC 191 (Ch)), which has determined that a sole director cannot satisfy the quorum requirements under the Model Articles of Association. I note that Model Articles for your company have been filed which means that Article 10(2) is the relevant provision. This Article advises that a quorum for a directors meeting can be fixed from time to time but sets the default quorum as 2 directors. Previously it was considered that article 7(2) of the Model Articles permitted decision making by 1 director where there is only 1 director of the company. This has now been interpreted to mean that a company must have at least 2 directors to make valid decisions (such as agreeing to enter into a mortgage) where this provision has not been varied in the model articles.As you are the sole director of your company, without amendment it means that any board meetings and minutes that you complete, do not currently comply with the articles of the company.In order to proceed, we need for you to arrange for your company’s articles of association to be varied by way of a written resolution, and the resolution to be filed at Companies House, so as to disapply the quorum requirement under article 10(2). I will need you to send evidence of this to me as soon as possible to ensure you comply with your mortgage terms and conditions, which require you to provide valid board meeting minutes.Budget: $120Posted On: February 23, 2024 10:40 UTCCategory: Business & Corporate LawSkills:Legal, Legal Writing, Corporate Law, Real Estate, Finance & AccountingSkills: Legal, Legal Writing, Corporate Law, Real Estate, Finance & AccountingCountry: United Kingdom""

But in essence the stories are: boy meets girl, there is a connection, they fall in love, they have their happy ever after.Because of the intended readership market there is no crisis, peril or danger. Language should be simple and positive (I encourage use of words such as wonderful, happy, beautiful, etc.). The story should not place heavy demands on the reader and is not overloaded with too many characters and unnecessary details.You will be suggest your own plots, subject to my approval. Native North American English only.I am happy to work at your schedule. Deliveries must be fully edited / proof read by you and be ready to publish. content: Delivered crafting, well, defined-based improvements by transforming ad-hoc tasks into repeatable, automated processes that improved productivity and accuracy for clients.
original:
Improve this resume bullet:
""Crafting a well-defined brief for your designer while leaving ample room for creativity is essential. Here’s how you can articulate your business concept and objectives for the logo, setting a clear scope without constraining creativity:"Home It" Logo Design BriefBusiness Overview:"Home It" is revolutionizing the furniture and interior design industry through a unique e-commerce platform. Unlike traditional furniture shopping, we delve into the essence of personalization and customization. Our service allows customers to submit their room layouts, which we then use to match them with top interior designers. These designers create bespoke designs tailored to each customer's individual preferences, transforming their space into a personalized haven. Our mission is to materialize our customers' visions into reality, making their dream home a tangible experience.Objective:The logo should embody the spirit of bespoke interior design and personalization, reflecting our innovative approach to transforming spaces. It must convey sophistication, creativity, and the bespoke nature of our service. The goal is for viewers to immediately grasp that "Home It" is not just about buying furniture; it's about crafting personalized living spaces that echo the customer's unique style and needs.Target Audience:Our target audience includes homeowners and renters ranging from mid-20s to late 50s who appreciate design and are seeking customized solutions for their living spaces. They value quality, uniqueness, and the ability to tailor their environment to reflect their personal taste.Creative Freedom:We encourage creativity and innovation in the design process. The logo should be more than a graphic; it should tell a story and evoke a feeling of home, personalization, and the transformation journey we offer our clients. While we've outlined the essence of our brand, we invite you to bring your own vision and ideas to the forefront. Feel free to explore different concepts, styles, and elements that you believe will best represent "Home It."Design Considerations:The logo should be versatile, easily adaptable across various media including web, print, and merchandise.It should remain effective both in color and in black and white.While we're open to any creative direction, the final design should be clear and recognizable at different sizes.Deliverables:Few Concepts to be delivered to pick from them.Pick concept and then have iteration for reviews till final versionVariations for different applications (e.g., website, business cards, social media).A brief explanation of the concept behind the chosen design and any specific symbolism used along with brand identity document.Timeline and Communication:Please provide initial concepts within 3-4 days for first draft and then entire project to be finalized in 2 weeks, with room for feedback and revisions. Open communication is key to us; we're eager to see your preliminary ideas and develop them further together.This brief aims to provide a clear understanding of our brand and the message we want to convey without limiting your creative process. We look forward to seeing your unique interpretation of "Home It" and bringing our brand identity to life.Budget: $150Posted On: February 13, 2024 14:38 UTCCategory: Graphic DesignSkills:Graphic Design, Brand Identity & Guidelines, Logo DesignSkills: Graphic Design, Brand Identity & Guidelines, Logo DesignCountry: United Arab Emirates""

""The vision of the Public Service Data Strategy is to establish a data ecosystem that will improve how we govern, manage and re-use data in a secure, efficient, and transparent way, for the benefit of citizens, businesses and policy makers.In November 2021 GeoHive was relaunched as the National Geospatial Data Hub, and is designed to provide easy discovery, evaluation and access to authoritative geospatial data produced by Public Sector bodies (PSBs), as outlined in the Strategy.A Data Governance Board has also been put in place whose role, among many, is to advise the Minister on the introduction of data management standards and guidelines.To enable the integration and sharing of national spatial information and in order to ensure that this ecosystem can exist in Ireland, Public Service Bodies must ensure they make their spatial data available, usable and to collected to a certain standard.Each student must:• Identify a spatial dataset that is currently unavailable at the national level for Ireland but should be provided on the national hub.• Investigate this data at PSB level and see if it is possible to create a national data set for your chosen topic from the data sets currently available.• Evaluate how this data was collected, in terms of attributes and format, and any barriers encountered in doing so.• Make recommendations on how this data should be collected going forward in preparation for a national data set.• Present your findings and data sets in an ArcOnline Story Map.Marks for Story Map: 40% of total module grade. Marks will be given for the presentation of the story map as well as the creation of your data set.Budget: $10Posted On: February 18, 2024 16:11 UTCCategory: IllustrationSkills:GISSkills: GISCountry: Pakistan""

""I am a professionally-trained singer/songwriter transitioning into releasing music as an active recording artist by the end of 2024. Production-wise I am looking for something adjacent (but not limited) to the sounds of: The Weeknd, Brent Faiyaz, Joji, Ty Dolla $ign, Justin Timberlake, Frank Ocean, & Giveon.I am currently in the process of selecting my best work/demos and crafting them into original songs with quality producers. Many of my songs were written over 'type beats' and my vocal tracks are according to the BPM/key the type beat is set to. Everything else is fair-play, all melodies and songwriting is original, so we can transform these songs into polished, professional-sounding music.I have several songs written as piano compositions and several songs free-written (in-time/key but not transcribed). Regardless of which of the 3 options the demo is, the function will remain. I will provide you with my lead vocal track (and any accompanying stems if they are done and if they help) and you will construct the beat around it. I will provide guidance on my desires for the sound/emotion of the track in a concise document and include references to other songs that are in a similar pocket/style.ALL work must be original (sans any fair use policies) and free of copyright infringement. The completed instrumental must be usable by me as the appointed recording artist, used for-profit, and in accordance to my PRO (performance rights organization). You will retain 25% of the masters (the average rate for producers) and we can negotiate our split on publishing.If our first track goes well, we can work on future projects together as well, potentially even set up a bulk deal where I get 2-3 beats for a reduced price, under the same conditions. We can discuss more of this later. Please keep in mind that I am looking for someone very experienced with music and production who's wanting to work with artists that are prepared to take the next step. If you are still figuring things out with production and feel you need more time, you can always bookmark this post and reach out within the year (I will be active throughout), if it's meant to be it's meant to be. I do have an audio engineer but we can discuss the option of you completing the final mix for an additional price IF we feel this is best for the song.Thank you so much for your time and consideration, I know it was a lot to read but it is important that I am transparent about everything. Let's give this everything we got and create something big.Budget: $250Posted On: February 22, 2024 23:39 UTCCategory: Music ProductionSkills:Music, Music Production, Music Composition, Music Arrangement, Audio Production, Sound Mixing, Logic Pro, Audio MasteringSkills: Music, Music Production, Music Composition, Music Arrangement, Audio Production, Sound Mixing, Logic Pro, Audio MasteringCountry: Canada""
